forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Chance Drizzle then Light Rain Likely
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of drizzle before 4am, then rain likely. Cloudy, with a low around 53. Northeast wind around 5 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy. High near 61, with temperatures falling to around 59 in the afternoon. Southeast wind 5 to 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the night envelops Downtown San Francisco, a cloak of drizzle will whisper through the air, giving way to rain in the early hours. The sky, a thick tapestry of grey clouds, blankets the city, promising a low of 53 degrees, while a gentle northeast wind stirs softly at around five miles per hour. With a 60% chance of precipitation, the streets may gleam with the promise of moisture, though any substantial accumulation will remain modest—less than a tenth of an inch.

Looking ahead to Sunday, the rain becomes a steady companion throughout the day, accompanied by a lingering overcast that will keep temperatures cooler, peaking near 61 before surrendering to a slight dip in the afternoon. A southeast breeze of 5 to 9 mph will add to the chill in the air, as a robust 90% chance of rain guarantees a damp experience. As you step out, consider layering comfortably in a waterproof jacket and sturdy shoes. The charm of the city invites you to explore cozy cafés where you can savor a warm drink or to treat yourself to the artistry of a local museum while the world outside transforms into a watercolor painting of rain and muted colors. Embrace the day with curiosity—a quiet morning stroll on a nearly deserted beach could be invigorating, or a meandering walk through the rain-kissed streets might uncover delightful surprises in hidden shops.
